results.title: Solar promise
results.creator_credit: Tom Putnam, Henry Mayer and Bullfrog Films
results.brief_description: Examines the use of solare energy for home heating. Active and passive systems are illustrated and the principles of each are outlined. A variety of homes are shown and the costs, advantages and potential for a wide range of climate conditions are fully covered. Reference is made to the indians of southwest America who understood and used passive solar heating.

results.title: Solar power
results.creator_credit: Leo A. Handel, Peter Mertens and Handel Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Discusses a large number of examples of solar power. Presents three specific areas of energy generation and preservation: passive solar heating, active thermal heating and photovoltaic production of electricity.

results.title: Solar family
results.brief_description: The evolution of the solar system revealed according to the planetesimal hypothesis, followed by a portrayal of the real and apparent motion of the planets. Among the special phenomena presented are: the phases of Venus; retrograde motion of Mars; Jupiter and its satellites; the apparent motion of Saturn’s rings; orbits of the planetoids, Eros and Anteros; orbit of Halley’s comet; and the motion of the solar system in space.

results.title: Solar energy: how it works
results.brief_description: In order that energy from the sun be used it must be either concentrated, absorbed, trapped or converted. Simple experiments by children and commercial applications provide examples of how this can be done.
results.description: In order that energy from the sun be used it must be either concentrated, absorbed, trapped or converted. Simple experiments by children and commercial applications provide examples of how this can be done.

results.title: Solar cells outback
results.brief_description: Deals with applications of the new, cheaper, solar panels to produce electricity in outback Australia beyond the reach of the power grid. The potential of solar powered electric pumps to replace the windpump is also discussed in detail.
results.description: Deals with applications of the new, cheaper, solar panels to produce electricity in outback Australia beyond the reach of the power grid. The potential of solar powered electric pumps to replace the windpump is also discussed in detail.

results.title: Sojourn in rural Japan: a youth hostel trip
results.creator_credit: Japan. National Tourist Organisation and Shu Taguchi Productions
results.brief_description: A youth hostel trip in the Tohoku district where, more than in any other part of Japan, the old and simple ways still remain. This film shows the Towada National Park and the Yamagata and Hiraizumi areas which attract young people all the year round.

results.title: Soil fertility in South Africa
results.creator_credit: South Africa. Dept. of Education. Film Services Union and South African Government
results.brief_description: A note of warning is sounded and attention focused on various malpractices which lead to the deterioration or total destruction of the thin layer of fertile top soil. Remedial and preventative measures are explained and the farmer is encouraged to co-operate with the State in its campaign against retrogressive practices.

results.title: Soil erosion
results.creator_credit: Kenneth Villiers, Ezra Mir and Information Films of India
results.brief_description: India has suffered as much as any other agricultural country from the devastation of soil erosion. This film gives a vivid account of the effects of soil erosion on village life, and shows clearly the dangers of uncontrolled erosion. The Forestry Department of the Indian government is applying various methods to combat erosion.

results.title: Soil conservation for the Snowy Mountains Scheme
results.creator_credit: H Malcolm and Snowy Mountains Authority
results.brief_description: Shows what has been done, by planting grasses, shrubs and trees, to combat soil erosion and cover scarred surfaces which have been left by road-making in the Snowy Mountains Scheme.
